entry.name: Necrons/Destroyer
entry.value: Aura of Destruction

entry.name: Necrons/DestroyerDescription
entry.value: Increases the accuracy of adjacent Destroyers.

entry.name: Necrons/DestroyerFlavor
entry.value: The Heavy Destroyer Lord guides his peers with inhuman lethality. These followers of organized destruction become more effective when they receive their orders directly from their Lord.

entry.name: Necrons/Hainevivant
entry.value: Protocols for destruction of living

entry.name: Necrons/HainevivantDescription
entry.value: The Heavy Destroyer Lord is more effective against biological targets, but less against mechanical or inert targets.

entry.name: Necrons/HainevivantFlavor
entry.value: Already formidable, the Heavy Destroyer Lord decided to focus on biological targets to significantly increase its effectiveness. It therefore becomes much more dangerous against all targets that are not vehicles, fortifications, Necrons or cyborgs. This protocol is incompatible with the destruction of the inert.

entry.name: Necrons/Haineinerte
entry.value: Protocols for destruction of the inert

entry.name: Necrons/HaineinerteDescription
entry.value: The Heavy Destroyer Lord is more effective against mechanical targets, but less against biological targets.

entry.name: Necrons/HaineinerteFlavor
entry.value: Already formidable, the Heavy Destroyer Lord decided to focus on mechanical targets to significantly increase its effectiveness. It therefore becomes much more dangerous against all targets such as vehicles, fortifications, Necrons or cyborgs. This protocol is incompatible with that of the destruction of the living.

entry.name: Necrons/GaussMaxOK
entry.value: Skill needed

entry.name: Necrons/GaussMaxOKDescription
entry.value: This weapon cannot be used without the associated skill.

entry.name: Necrons/Siphon
entry.value: Energy Drain

entry.name: Necrons/SiphonDescription
entry.value: The infected Canoptek Spyder stuns an enemy vehicle to drain energy.

entry.name: Necrons/SiphonFlavor
entry.value: Although rare, it is possible that Canoptek Spyder can drain electrical power from vehicles or buildings. In general it is often to stop a debacle by finding the energy necessary to relieve the destroyed Necron troops. But the infected Mecarachnid does not hesitate to plant its numerous claws in the metal of its victim to drain the energy, leaving the vehicle empty and vulnerable.

entry.name: Necrons/Corruption
entry.value: Machine corruption

entry.name: Necrons/CorruptionDescription
entry.value: The infected Canoptek Spyder spreads corrupted code that reduces the accuracy of enemy vehicles and increases their morale loss.

entry.name: Necrons/CorruptionFlavor
entry.value: The Necrons have technology beyond comprehension and many species have tried to unlock their secrets, but in vain. The slightest synthetic or mechanical entity fears the technologies that the Necrons can deploy on the battlefield. Because when corrupted Necron code is released, vehicles and cyborgs quickly suffer damages or hallucinations. Leaving crews and troops to contend with machines that are going completely crazy.

entry.name: Necrons/Soif
entry.value: Blood Lust

entry.name: Necrons/SoifDescription
entry.value: The infected Canoptek Spyder heals itself when she deals damage.

entry.name: Necrons/SoifFlavor
entry.value: The final transformation that would allow a Flayed Ones to quench his thirst never occurs, lending credence to the legend that the curse was the final gift of one of the C'tan: Llandu'gor, the Flayer. For this Canoptek Spider corrupted by the virus, it is indeed this same hunger which guides its senses.

entry.name: Necrons/Enragement
entry.value: Fury of the Flayed Ones

entry.name: Necrons/EnragementDescription
entry.value: Infected Scarab Canopteks can sacrifice themselves to increase attack, movement, damages and grant life theft to the targeted Flayed Ones squad.

entry.name: Necrons/EnragementFlavor
entry.value: Scarabs corrupted by the virus can easily arouse the senses of Flayed Ones. By uniting with them like parasites, they gain in speed, aggressiveness and lethality.

entry.name: Necrons/Monolithium
entry.value: Energy Grid

entry.name: Necrons/MonolithiumDescription
entry.value: The Doomsday Monolith drains energy from a Monolith, which deactivates, to increase the power of its weaponry.

entry.name: Necrons/MonolithiumFlavor
entry.value: Instead of firing a particle whip, or teleporting a unit, nearby Monoliths can grant the energy from their Power Matrix to the Doomsday Monolith, which is capable of focusing this power to increase the intensity of its Gauss Obliterator.

entry.name: Necrons/PSG
entry.value: Phase Shift Generator

entry.name: Necrons/PSGDescription
entry.value: The Doomsday Monolith reduces damage taken by nearby units.

entry.name: Necrons/PSGFlavor
entry.value: A Phase Shift Generator is a device found on Necron Pylons. It is presumably similar to the Wraith's phase shift ability but on a much greater scale. The field projected by the Pylon surrounds it for a great distance and allows Necrons within the field to survive attacks which would normally destroy them outright.

entry.name: Necrons/Phase
entry.value: Phase Teleport

entry.name: Necrons/PhaseDescription
entry.value: The Doomsday Monolith teleports and becomes resistant to ranged attacks.

entry.name: Necrons/PhaseFlavor
entry.value: Necron knowledge and technologies related to the art of controlling time and matter remain unmatched to this day. What seems impossible for other species remains simple for the Necrons, who can teleport their Monoliths over great distances and despite their imposing mass. Worse, as the Monolith resurfaces at the desired position it is almost impossible to deal any damage to it as it finishes its phase. Like a spectral pyramid, it is visible to all but also intangible.

entry.name: Necrons/EnergyField
entry.value: Unknown energy field

entry.name: Necrons/EnergyFieldDescription
entry.value: The Doomsday Monolith suffers less damages.

entry.name: Necrons/EnergyFieldFlavor
entry.value: No one knows how this energy field works, however its effectiveness is undoubted. Even the most violent impacts and explosions fail to pierce the imposing mass of the Doomsday Monolith.

entry.name: Necrons/PartSpiri
entry.value: Cloud of Spiritual Particles

entry.name: Necrons/PartSpiriDescription
entry.value: The Void Dragon's C'tan Shard becomes harder to hit.

entry.name: Necrons/PartSpiriFlavor
entry.value: Covered in this cloud, the projectiles will pass through the Void Dragon's C'tan Shard as if nothing had happened. This vaporous form will not last but will allow the splinter to get out of a bad situation to recover before

entry.name: Necrons/Moléculaire
entry.value: Molecular Destabilization

entry.name: Necrons/MoléculaireDescription
entry.value: The Void Dragon's C'tan Shard reduces the armor of nearby enemies.

entry.name: Necrons/MoléculaireFlavor
entry.value: The Void Dragon Shard filled the air around it with a distorted, stinging sound. With a single gesture, he can undo the war machines of the lower races, then attract disintegrated matter to herself like black holes in order to reconstitute their constantly fluctuating envelope. Complete control of matter allows him to disassemble the strongest materials with a single thought.

entry.name: Necrons/VoltaicStorm
entry.value: Voltaic Storm

entry.name: Necrons/VoltaicStormDescription
entry.value: The Void Dragon's C'tan Shard gains additional attacks for his transdimensional thunderbolts.

entry.name: Necrons/VoltaicStormFlavor
entry.value: When this C'tan points one imperious hand, foes reel as the air sings with a monstrous whine. The awful sound builds, then erupts into a sudden and ferocious storm of emerald lightning to annihilate all it touches.

entry.name: Necrons/EmpathicObliterator
entry.value: Psionic Strike

entry.name: Necrons/EmpathicObliteratorDescription
entry.value: Trazyn performs a powerful attack that stuns his target and weakens nearby targets.

entry.name: Necrons/EmpathicObliteratorFlavor
entry.value: Should the Empathic Obliterator slay an enemy, a psionic shockwave ripples out from the body of the victim, striking down all nearby creatures of similar mind and purpose.

entry.name: Necrons/Musée
entry.value: My collection is incomplete

entry.name: Necrons/MuséeDescription
entry.value: Trazyn can capture targets more often and generates more influence.

entry.name: Necrons/MuséeFlavor
entry.value: I realize you've been wandering my galleries, and the fact that you were able to identify in such a short time that three regiments of Catachan soldiers were still missing from my Acabrius War collection speaks to your eye for this genre. thing. But from there to send me five complete regiments ! Such generosity will allow me to eliminate and replace a few less valuable pieces in my collection. — Hyperparchment from Trazyn the Infinite to Inquisitor Valéria

entry.name: Necrons/Musée1
entry.value: Unit Capture

entry.name: Necrons/Musée1Description
entry.value: Trazyn captures and ships his weakened new catch off-planet, generating a bit of influence.

entry.name: Necrons/Musée1Flavor
entry.value: The Prismatic Galleries. These are some of the most prized possessions of Trazyn and consist of holographic events recapturing events from history deemed worthy of preservation. These galleries are not populated by mere sculpture, but by conscious living beings transmuted into the holograph themselves.

entry.value: Vehicle Capture

entry.name: Necrons/Musée2Description
entry.value: Trazyn captures and ships his weakened new catch off-planet, generating influence.

entry.name: Necrons/Musée2Flavor
entry.value: The Prismatic Galleries. These are some of the most prized possessions of Trazyn and consist of holographic events recapturing events from history deemed worthy of preservation. These galleries are not populated by mere sculpture, but by conscious living beings transmuted into the holograph themselves.

entry.name: Necrons/Musée3
entry.value: Hero Capture

entry.name: Necrons/Musée3Description
entry.value: Trazyn captures and ships his weakened new catch off-planet, generating a lot of influence.

entry.name: Necrons/Musée3Flavor
entry.value: The Prismatic Galleries. These are some of the most prized possessions of Trazyn and consist of holographic events recapturing events from history deemed worthy of preservation. These galleries are not populated by mere sculpture, but by conscious living beings transmuted into the holograph themselves.

entry.name: Necrons/Collector
entry.value: Quantum storage

entry.name: Necrons/CollectorFlavor
entry.value: Trazyn can store a large quantity of objects and artifacts that he may have found on the planet. Although he prefers collecting more than war, he will not hesitate to use them if the situation calls for it.

entry.name: Necrons/Infini
entry.value: Lord of the Infinite

entry.name: Necrons/InfiniFlavor
entry.value: After millennia of traveling the galaxy, Trazyn is impervious to loss of morale and therefore cannot be shaken. If he fails, he will come back and start again some time later. He is patient, smart and meticulous.

entry.name: Necrons/PhaseShifter
entry.value: Phase Shifter

entry.name: Necrons/PhaseShifterDescription
entry.value: Orikan gains ranged damage reduction.

entry.name: Necrons/PhaseShifterFlavor
entry.value: A Phase Shifter is a form of Necron phase technology that truly demonstrates that species' technological superiority over all others in the galaxy. Using a form of unknown inter-dimensional science, a Phase Shifter renders its bearer's form hazy and indistinct, as though he was not completely corporeal. Shots and blows can then pass through the user's mechanical necrodermis body, meaning that even the most powerful weapons cannot harm him.

entry.name: Necrons/TemporalSnare
entry.value: Temporal Snare

entry.name: Necrons/TemporalSnareDescription
entry.value: Orikan slow down a target that deal less attacks, suffer more damages and move one tile only.

entry.name: Necrons/TemporalSnareFlavor
entry.value: A Temporal Snare is a Necron device that warps the fabric of space-time itself, creating a bubble of altered space-time where time flows more slowly for anyone or anything trapped within it. They are only carried by the Cryptek Orikan. Each Temporal Snare is a technologically-advanced temporal trap that can severely impede enemy movement once it is activated, whether those trapped within its field are vehicles or infantry. Thus, even when traversing the smoothest of terrains, once a snare is activated, enemy units can still find themselves moving at a snail's pace from the subjective perception of those observers outside the device's range of effect.

entry.name: Necrons/StarsAreRight
entry.value: Stars Are Right

entry.name: Necrons/StarsAreRightDescription
entry.value: Orikan becomes more powerful and gains attacks, damages, movement and accuracy for a limited time.

entry.name: Necrons/StarsAreRightFlavor
entry.value: Wherever he goes, whenever he fights, there is always a chance that the stars will come into alignment and restore to Orikan a portion of ancient power. Whenever this happens, the body of Orikan coruscates with pent-up energy, and his prowess on the battlefield increases tenfold. However, such correct celestial alignments are often fleeting, and Orikan eventually powers down, sometimes mere minutes after he first received his initial empowerment.

entry.name: Necrons/StarsAreRight
entry.value: Stars Are Not Right

entry.name: Necrons/StarsAreRightDescription
entry.value: Orikan becomes weak and deals less attacks, damage, accuracy and movement for a limited time.

entry.name: Necrons/StarsAreRightFlavor
entry.value: Wherever he goes, whenever he fights, there is always a chance that the stars will come into alignment and restore to Orikan a portion of ancient power. Whenever this happens, the body of Orikan coruscates with pent-up energy, and his prowess on the battlefield increases tenfold. However, such correct celestial alignments are often fleeting, and Orikan eventually powers down, sometimes mere minutes after he first received his initial empowerment.

entry.name: Necrons/Futur
entry.value: Master of the Future

entry.name: Necrons/FuturDescription
entry.value: Orikan does not trigger enemy overwatch.

entry.name: Necrons/FuturFlavor
entry.value: Orikan is a consummate chronomancer, able to calculate the events of the future from the patterns of the stars. Thus did he know of the Fall of the Aeldari, the Rise of Man, the Horus Heresy and the coming of the Tyranids many thousands of Terran years before they came to pass. Through careful study and scrutiny, Orikan can even divine lesser occurrences such as movement of fleets, the destinies of individuals, even the strategies undertaken by campaigning armies and events not important enough to reshape the galaxy, but the foreknowledge of which can dramatically change the fortunes of the beholder.

entry.name: Necrons/StaffofTomorrow
entry.value: Staff of the Tomorrow

entry.name: Necrons/StaffofTomorrowDescription
entry.value: Orikan stuns his enemy when he acts on overwatch.

entry.name: Necrons/StaffofTomorrowFlavor
entry.value: This unique example of advanced Necron time manipulation technology exists a fraction of a second ahead of any given moment in the normal space-time continuum. This property allows Orikan to strike at his target an instant before the foe even moves to do so. The Staff of Tomorrow can also penetrate all known forms of infantry armour, in a similar way to a Power Weapon, further enhancing its devastating effect in melee.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/WisdomOfTheAncients
entry.value: Wisdom Of The Ancients

entry.name: SpaceMarines/WisdomOfTheAncientsDescription
entry.value: Buffs adjacent units accuracy and attacks.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/WisdomOfTheAncientsFlavor
entry.value: Each fallen champion who rests within the sarcophagus of a Dreadnought has seen a thousand battles and slain foes beyond counting. All such noble warriors are immensely inspiring to their battle-brothers.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/UnyeildingAncient
entry.value: Unyielding Ancient

entry.name: SpaceMarines/UnyeildingAncientDescription
entry.value: Grants damage reduction and slow passive regen per turn.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/UnyeildingAncientFlavor
entry.value: Incoming fire spatters like rain off his towering adamantium and ceramite hull.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/DutyEternal
entry.value: Duty Eternal

entry.name: SpaceMarines/DutyEternalDescription
entry.value: Grants damage reduction for a single turn.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/DutyEternalFlavor
entry.value: Having teasted death before, the pilot of each Dreadnought is determined to do his duty before his end finally comes.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/WeaponsPlatform
entry.value: Weapons Platform

entry.name: SpaceMarines/WeaponsPlatformDescription
entry.value: Grants extra inventory slots.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/WeaponsPlatformFlavor
entry.value: Dreadnoughts are war incarnate, towering machines that advance forwards with thunderous strides, fiery death roaring from the myriad of heavy weapons mounted on their hulls.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/FoundingMember
entry.value: Founding Member

entry.name: SpaceMarines/FoundingMemberDescription
entry.value: Shares knowledge with adjacent units and the Chapter, boosting level and research rate.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/FoundingMemberFlavor
entry.value: The vast amount of knowledge and experience earned by Venerable Dreadnoughts places them in high regard amongst the other warriors of their Chapter. From the lowliest Initiate to the Chapter Master, all will eventually seek out the advice of one of these Ancients.

entry.name: SpaceMarines/AncientAdministrator
entry.value: I Bring Redemption

entry.name: SpaceMarines/AncientAdministratorDescription
entry.value: Calls down a Fortress of Redemption

entry.name: SpaceMarines/AncientAdministratorFlavor
entry.value: With This Bolter, I Bring Death. With This Beacon, I Bring Redemption.
